intro: Torgesia minuartioides, commonly known as the alpine rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its leaves are usually basal, forming a rosette, and the stems are often covered in fine hairs. Torgesia minuartioides is known for its resilience to cold climates and is often found in high-altitude environments.
